briefdescription.para: Indicates a pin is not being used.

detaileddescription.para: If hardware flow control is not being used, the UART CTS and RTS pins should be set to UART2CC32XX_PIN_UNASSIGNED.

briefdescription.para: Indicates a DMA channel is not being used.

detaileddescription.para: If DMA is not being used, the UART rxDmaChannel and txDmaChannel should be set to UART2CC32XX_DMACH_UNASSIGNED.
PIN 1 is used for UART1 TX
PIN 2 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 3 is used for UART0 TX
PIN 4 is used for UART0 RX
PIN 7 is used for UART1 TX
PIN 8 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 16 is used for UART1 TX
PIN 17 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 45 is used for UART0 RX
PIN 45 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 53 is used for UART0 TX
PIN 55 is used for UART0 TX
PIN 55 is used for UART1 TX
PIN 57 is used for UART0 RX
PIN 57 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 58 is used for UART1 TX
PIN 59 is used for UART1 RX
PIN 62 is used for UART0 TX
PIN 50 is used for UART0 CTS
PIN 50 is used for UART0 RTS
PIN 50 is used for UART1 RTS
PIN 52 is used for UART0 RTS
PIN 61 is used for UART0 RTS
PIN 61 is used for UART0 CTS
PIN 61 is used for UART1 CTS
PIN 62 is used for UART0 RTS
PIN 62 is used for UART1 RTS
FIFO threshold of 1/8 full
FIFO threshold of 2/8 full
FIFO threshold of 4/8 full
FIFO threshold of 6/8 full
FIFO threshold of 7/8 full

briefdescription.para: UART TX/RX interrupt FIFO threshold select.

detaileddescription.para: Defined FIFO thresholds for generation of both TX interrupt and RX interrupt. If the RX and TX FIFO and thresholds are not set in the HwAttrs, the RX interrupt FIFO threshold is set to 1/8 full, and the TX interrupt FIFO threshold is set to 1/8 full.

memberdef.argsstring: (UART2_Handle handle, void *buffer, size_t size, size_t *bytesRead, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: UART2CC32XX_read

memberdef.argsstring: (UART2_Handle handle, const void *buffer, size_t size, size_t *bytesWritten, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: UART2CC32XX_write

briefdescription.para: UART driver implementation for a CC32XX UART controller.

detaileddescription.para: The UART header file should be included in an application as follows: #include<ti/drivers/UART2.h> #include<ti/drivers/uart2/UART2CC32XX.h>
Refer to UART2.h for a complete description of APIs and examples of use.
